For an ideal gas, PV = nRT
Use the relationship P₁V₁/T₁ = P₂V₂/T₂ for the same amount of gas
Rearrange to solve for T₂: T₂ = (P₂V₂/P₁V₁) × T₁
Substitute the values: T₂ = (2×10³ Pa × 2×10⁻³ m³) / (3×10³ Pa × 2×10⁻³ m³) × 300 K
Simplify to find T₂ = (2/3) × 300 K = 200 K
Convert back to Celsius: T₂ = 200 K - 273.15 = -73.15°C
